author: eagle
title: Translate Pool Peek mobile: French
description: It is not straight forward for non-English speaking users to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is indeed a problem in the challenge that needs to be addressed. A lot of people who are not English-speaking really find it difficult to defy the information coming out of Cardano. Honestly, there's been a lot of attempts by the community to sort of break this barrier to ensure all-inclusive and a typical example is the diversification of Catalyst Town Hall which used to be just the Main Town Hall (Eastern) edition but now with the introduction of African Town Hall and others, people are able to join a town hall that has their cultural sentiment and receive the usual same information from the usual Main Town Hall in their native language and cultural feel. Introducing this idea into relaying of information about Stake Pools is indeed worth a solution that addresses the problem of language barrier. You know, you may not want to invest your time, money, and even knowledge in something you don't understand. The opposite of this is what I see to be the impact this proposal is going to have on the Cardano Ecosystem. i.e., safe onboarding of people with different language background and French at that, to invest in staking.
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
From this proposal, it is stated that "This is easily achievable as we have already translated the application into multiple foreign languages.". However, I got a copy of the application from the App Store and unfortunately, it's got only 1 language pack which is English. I tried accessing the website link provided in this proposal to verify if the translated versions were indeed done or not as claimed but it looks like it still has the same language pack which is English. From this, I'm thinking it would have been great and helpful if the proposing team had provided evidence on the translations made so far. But, once they've been able to build the interface in English, I don't think it's much of a work since all they need is a translator to translate the contents from English to French and then upload this into the application. It may be quite technical which's not my field of expertise  but I think any good technical team should be able to integrate easily. 
From this proposal there's little information given about the team and it's making me feel quite skeptical with the feasibility as far as implementation is concerned. It's stated clearly that the help of a professional translation service would be needed in order to implement this proposal and they've budgeted $1K for that service but according to research from Fiverr, a well known job market, the premium charge for 900 words translation which usually takes 3 days (72 hours) is $15 which's  1.5% of $1K. Huge difference. I suggest the team should provide information on how many hours this translation service is going to work and what the price is tag is. That would enable the community to know whether or not the requested budget is overstated or understated and thus feasible or not for successful implementation.
Also, $400 is allocated for development but there's no information on who this developer is. No name, contact, etc. but only a brief description which says; "The primary developer for this mobile application has over 10 years of mobile development experience and his applications have been downloaded from the Google Play and Apple App Stores several million times." and yet no links to some of his past success. 
Even though the link https://pool-peek.web.app leads to a nice website which clearly gives a great picture of the impact of this proposal, there's no specific information on the team behind it and it makes me feel quite skeptical about the feasibility of a successful implementation of this proposal if funded unless the proposing team can really clarify the raised concerns. 
Good luck to this proposal!
f6_assessments.q2: It is stated in this proposal that "Success will be seen as the application published to both Google Play and Apple App Store in French." which's great but I think a detailed roadmap could've been very useful for the community to at least know when to expect progress report and final delivery. A typical example of a good roadmap is one that details what would be done within 1 month post-funding, 2 month post-funding, 3 month post-funding and through till the project is successfully implemented fully. Details must include timelines and milestones. The team can also reach out to the several proposal workshops hosted by the Catalyst School in order to learn how to write great Catalyst proposal. Good luck to this proposal and I look forward to greater outcome but for now, I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress of its goal.

f6_assessments.q0:
We know that one of the main objectives of the challenge is to use Cardano's technology to build more modern and efficient solutions for Africa. To this end, it is essential that sources of information and knowledge are available to many citizens of this continent in a language that is widely used locally.

In this context, since many African countries have French as one of their languages, we can observe that this proposal will have an impact consistent with the challenge proposal. Furthermore, as technology penetrates further into the African continent, the greater will be the interest in how to allocate and invest ADA. At this point, having an app like Pool Peek fully translated into a widely used language, it will be possible to bring more strength and outreach to the ADA.

Thus, the impact generated by this investment, already in the short term, is a greater popularization of the Cardano platform, and even the budget for the realization of this translation, $1400, seems quite feasible with the service to be performed.
f6_assessments.q1:
Uma vez que o projeto se trata de uma ideia muito importante, porém não necessariamente complexa ou inovadora, não é necessária uma estruturação de etapas muito complexa ou de um grande número de profissionais na equipe para que o objetivo seja realizado. 

É citado também que o aplicativo já foi traduzido para diversas outras línguas, demonstrando assim que a atividade aqui proposta é perfeitamente realizável. Nesse contexto, temos também que o desenvolvedor principal do aplicativo é citado como bastante experiente no ramo (cerca de 10 anos de experiência), o que certamente faz do aplicativo bastante escalável, facilitando sua tradução. 

Já para a realização da tradução para a língua francesa, será utilizado um serviço profissional de tradução a um custo condizente ($1000). Os $400 gastos com desenvolvimento também parecem razoáveis, uma vez que a mudança em si dos termos de uma língua para outra é um processo bem direto. 

Em relação a custos de marketing com o projeto, como o aplicativo já é utilizado e possui uma boa média de avaliação no Google Play e App Store, nesse caso não é necessária uma grande preocupação com sua divulgação. Além de que, com a expansão de outros projetos da Cardano através da África, o Pool Peek deve consequentemente ficar mais conhecido e utilizado em diversas localidades que falam francês, até mesmo não necessariamente na África.
f6_assessments.q2:
The verification of the success of the project can be verified in a simple way, with the availability of the translated application on the previously mentioned platforms. One way to gather user feedback and capture potential issues would also be to look at user comments about the translated app.

With that, if any functionality has become less useful or not so clear due to translation, it would be easy to locate that issue for quick resolution. In this way, an important step towards increasing Cardano's reach in Africa will have been achieved, creating a more cohesive and profitable environment.

f6_assessments.q2: You need to provide more detailed information so that the community can track the progress of Pool Peek's development. For example: What will you do in January and what will be the results? What is the 2nd and 3rd month of work? How long will it take you to complete the application? You do this the community will agree more.

f6_assessments.q0:
As a non English speaker, I find that this proposal has proposed such a simple but yet very crucial idea. It’s very fortunate that I can speak multiple languages fluently but I can understand the difficulties when it comes to learn something new in a second language. There has been so many research points out the future of French is African as 44% of French speaker living in Africa. The blockchain is not such a new thing but also everyone is familiar to it. Most of the courses, studying website and information about blockchain are in English. It definitely bring some certain difficulties and hesitations to users who don’t speak English well and want to learn about Cardano.  Having an app that runs in their own languages can surely help people adapt to it more quickly and moreover, it will work out mentally that the market is well appreciated. 
Hence, I find that this proposal strongly aligns with the challenge. The idea of this proposal is doable and very essential. If anything, I would want the team to be more concern about the QC process of the translation and have some professionals to make sure that all the academic terms are translated accurately.
f6_assessments.q1: Since the team  has already had translated the application into multiple foreign languages, I don’t think they will have a lot of struggles to develop a French version of the app. However, I’d very appreciate it if the proposer can provide a detailed timeline. How long will it take for recruitment, translation, QC and apply it onto the app? What is the amount of work like? How many working hours are needed? I get that the team is very confident since they have done it many time before but these information will help the community to justify the amount requested.
f6_assessments.q2: In term of audibility, I think it’s still missing a lot of key metrics and KPIs. I will suggest something like the number of the app downloads, the number of user using the app in French, the number of new users from Africa and such and the feedback of its impact on making people stake their Cardano, purchase and delegate Ada to a community stake pool or so. Without those numbers/ stats, it’s very difficult for the auditor to do their job and give the project the fairest feedback

f6_assessments.q0:
Pool Peek is a website and mobile app that helps you choose your stake pool. At first, one might think there is no need for another tool with these features, but when looking at how the website works, one can see that some of the features are not available elsewhere - at least not to my knowledge - and that actually makes Pool Peek a valuable tool to have and worth translating into other languages, that will help get as many people as possible understanding how their ADA is staked, and what the difference is between one pool and another.
As such, the impact this proposal can have on the Cardano ecosystem is quite positive, and it also addresses the challenge of Grow Africa, Grow Cardano. The same review applies to his other proposals for translation into other Asian and African languages, since the proposal text is almost identical.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very simple and extremely useful. It is about translating into French an application that already exists, an application that works to help people in the staking process. When translating into French, this would certainly increase the engagement of French speakers with one of the ecosystem's main activities. It is true that French is a highly spoken language on the African continent, so it will certainly benefit the continent, as it will facilitate this very important activity for its inhabitants, while also clearly benefiting the Cardano ecosystem, bringing in new users from Africa, thus achieving the specific objectives of the challenge. This also relates to the other challenge, of bringing new people to Cardano. The language barrier is certainly the one that makes the expansion of our blockchain the most difficult, and if we can gradually break it, Cardano's primary goals will certainly be achieved. The author has included two direct ways of proving the existence and work of the application he cites - we have the link that directs to the site and also a short video about the project. Finally, I believe that the impact will be very positive and is very much in line with the objectives of the proposed challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding this topic, little information is found here. As simple and straightforward as the project is, I'd like to suggest a few increments. For example: regarding the script, it would be interesting to know in which month or months the translation and development activities of the app into French would take place. As much as it has already been translated into other languages, it is important to understand how this process happens. Regarding the budget, I don't think there is more to be detailed, since it is a very small amount compared to the funding requested by most applicants, and it is very clear how it will be used. But in relation to the professionals involved, it is said that the main developer already has a lot of experience in the area and that he has applications with millions of downloads. Okay, but who is this person? What apps has he developed? I had to present it properly. Was it the author of the proposal? About the translation, who would be responsible for this part? The author claims that a professional translator or translator will be hired, but do we already have candidates in mind? And if so, what examples of previous work? I believe that as simple as the proposal is, such information could be included as well. I will give it four stars because I strongly believe that this project will work, but I missed those details.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress of this project is quite simple to trace, I see two paths. The first would be, as the author himself comments, to talk about the amount of downloads on the apple store/google play in French. This would be a direct indicator of how the application is being adopted/popularized by the target audience. It would be possible for the Cardano community to monitor this in a very simple way, accessing such information on their cell phones. A complement would also be to follow the translation process, I believe it should not be long, I suggest that some member of the French speaking community make use of the application and bring us this feedback, if everything is working well and as promised, if it is entirely translated and ergonomically arranged. Another idea is that the author of the proposal brings us some statistics, have French speakers in Africa intensified their activities with the pools? Has there been an increase in membership? There are other suggestions to be made for a full understanding of the project result. I will give it four stars because I agree that the proposal is auditable, but I believe it could have been further explored in this regard.

f6_assessments.q0:
Note to VCa: this proposal being very similar to several other proposals by the same team, my assessment may include similarities.
This proposal offers to translate into French an existing web-app named “Pool Peek Mobile”. This web app educates and assists new Cardano users about staking, includes a pool map and a pool search engine. 
This app has good reviews in Google and Apple app stores, and after having tested it myself, I found it useful, and I confirm I will keep it on my phone.
Even if French is a widely spoken language in Africa, so is English. The proposer does not show how this proposal will widely contribute to make Cardano the blockchain of choice in Africa. Indication about the evaluation of potential new users would enable a higher impact score.
f6_assessments.q1: The team intends to hire a professional translation service to support the work and evaluates the budget is 1kUSD. There should be no difficulty to perform this task, but the proposer could have made it more clear by adding precisions about what the team has done so far to source this external translation skill.
f6_assessments.q2: Success being defined as “the publication of the app on Google Play Store and Apple App store in French” does not align with the challenge brief. I recommend for a further application on Catalyst to include metrics that clearly relates the goal of the proposal to the challenge brief. In this case, for the “Grow Africa, Grow Cardano” challenge, it is for example: Number of African developers onboarded in 2022, local impact, local partnerships.

solution: We built Pool Peek Mobile to assist users with the staking process. We will translate the app into French (141 million African speakers).
experience: Pool Peek mobile has already been translated into several over languages and has and average rating of 4.5 stars across the Google Play and Apple App stores.
